content: 1 And it came to pass､ in the days of Ahasuerus,—the same Ahasuerus that reigned from India even unto Ethiopia, a hundred and twenty-seven provinces:
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ in the days of Ahasuerus,—the same Ahasuerus that reigned from India even unto Ethiopia, a hundred and twenty-seven provinces:

content: 2 in those days,—when King Ahasuerus was sitting on the throne of his kingdom, which was in Shusan the palace;
content_old: 2 in those days,—when King Ahasuerus was sitting on the throne of his kingdom, which was in Shusan the palace;

content: 3 in the third year of his reign he made a banquet unto all his rulers､ and his servants,—the power of Persia and Media､ the nobles and the rulers being before him;
content_old: 3 in the third year of his reign he made a banquet unto all his rulers､ and his servants,—the power of Persia and Media､ the nobles and the rulers being before him;

content: 4 when he showed the riches of the glory of his kingdom, and the splendour of his excellent majesty,—many days, a hundred and eighty days;
content_old: 4 when he showed the riches of the glory of his kingdom, and the splendour of his excellent majesty,—many days, a hundred and eighty days;

content: 5 that when these days were fulfilled the king made—for all the people that were present in Shusan the palace､ both for great and small—a banquet､ seven days,—in the court of the garden of the palace of the king:
content_old: 5 that when these days were fulfilled the king made—for all the people that were present in Shusan the palace､ both for great and small—a banquet､ seven days,—in the court of the garden of the palace of the king:

content: 6 white stuff､ cotton and blue､ being held fast with cords of fine linen and purple, upon rods of silver､ and pillars of white marble,—the couches being of gold and silver､ upon a pavement of alabaster and white marble､ and pearl and black marble.
content_old: 6 white stuff､ cotton and blue､ being held fast with cords of fine linen and purple, upon rods of silver､ and pillars of white marble,—the couches being of gold and silver､ upon a pavement of alabaster and white marble､ and pearl and black marble.

content: 7 And they gave them drink in vessels of gold, vessels､ from vessels being diverse,—even the wine of the kingdom in abundance､ by the bounty of the king.
content_old: 7 And they gave them drink in vessels of gold, vessels､ from vessels being diverse,—even the wine of the kingdom in abundance､ by the bounty of the king.

content: 8 And the drinking was according to the law､ no one compelling,—for so had the king appointed unto every chief of his household, that every man should do according to his pleasure.
content_old: 8 And the drinking was according to the law､ no one compelling,—for so had the king appointed unto every chief of his household, that every man should do according to his pleasure.

content: 9 Also Vashti the queen made a banquet for the women,—in the royal house which belonged to King Ahasuerus.
content_old: 9 Also Vashti the queen made a banquet for the women,—in the royal house which belonged to King Ahasuerus.

content: 10 On the seventh day when merry was the heart of the king with wine he commanded Mehuman､ Biztha､ Harbona､ Bigtha､ and Abagtha､ Zethar and Carcas､ the seven eunuchs who were waiting before King Ahasuerus,—
content_old: 10 On the seventh day when merry was the heart of the king with wine he commanded Mehuman､ Biztha､ Harbona､ Bigtha､ and Abagtha､ Zethar and Carcas､ the seven eunuchs who were waiting before King Ahasuerus,—

content: 11 to bring in Vashti the queen､ with the royal crown,—to show the peoples and the rulers her beauty, for of pleasing appearance was she.
content_old: 11 to bring in Vashti the queen､ with the royal crown,—to show the peoples and the rulers her beauty, for of pleasing appearance was she.

content: 12 But Queen Vashti refused to come in at the command of the king, which was given through the eunuchs,—and the king was exceeding wroth, and his anger burned within him.
content_old: 12 But Queen Vashti refused to come in at the command of the king, which was given through the eunuchs,—and the king was exceeding wroth, and his anger burned within him.

content: 13 Then said the king unto the wise men having knowledge of the times,—for so was the manner of the king before all having knowledge of law and judgment;
content_old: 13 Then said the king unto the wise men having knowledge of the times,—for so was the manner of the king before all having knowledge of law and judgment;

content: 14 and near unto him were Carshena､ Shethar､ Admatha､ Tarshish､ Meres､ Marsena､ Memucan,—the seven rulers of Persia and Media､ who used to behold the face of the king, who sat first､ in the kingdom—
content_old: 14 and near unto him were Carshena､ Shethar､ Admatha､ Tarshish､ Meres､ Marsena､ Memucan,—the seven rulers of Persia and Media､ who used to behold the face of the king, who sat first､ in the kingdom—

content: 15 According to law what ought to be done, with Queen Vashti,—for that she hath not performed the command of King Ahasuerus, through the eunuchs?
content_old: 15 According to law what ought to be done, with Queen Vashti,—for that she hath not performed the command of King Ahasuerus, through the eunuchs?

content: 16 Then said Memucan before the king and the rulers, Not against the king alone hath Vashti the queen acted perversely,—but against all the rulers､ and against all the peoples, who are in all the provinces of King Ahasuerus.
content_old: 16 Then said Memucan before the king and the rulers, Not against the king alone hath Vashti the queen acted perversely,—but against all the rulers､ and against all the peoples, who are in all the provinces of King Ahasuerus.

content: 17 For the report of the queen will go forth unto all women, so putting contempt upon their lords､ in their eyes,—when it is reported to them､ King Ahasuerus commanded Vashti the queen to be brought in before him､ but she came not.
content_old: 17 For the report of the queen will go forth unto all women, so putting contempt upon their lords､ in their eyes,—when it is reported to them､ King Ahasuerus commanded Vashti the queen to be brought in before him､ but she came not.

content: 18 And this day shall the ladies of Persia and Media､ who have heard the report of the queen､ tell it, unto all the lords of the king,—with enough of contempt and wrath.
content_old: 18 And this day shall the ladies of Persia and Media､ who have heard the report of the queen､ tell it, unto all the lords of the king,—with enough of contempt and wrath.

content: 19 If unto the king it seem good let there go forth a royal declaration from before him, and let it be written among the laws of Persia and Media､ so that it shall not pass away,—That Vashti is not to come in before King Ahasuerus, and her royal estate let the king give unto her neighbour､ who is better than she.
content_old: 19 If unto the king it seem good let there go forth a royal declaration from before him, and let it be written among the laws of Persia and Media､ so that it shall not pass away,—That Vashti is not to come in before King Ahasuerus, and her royal estate let the king give unto her neighbour､ who is better than she.

content: 20 When the edict of the king which he shall make､ is published throughout all his kingdom, for great it is then all wives will give honour unto their lords, both great and small.
content_old: 20 When the edict of the king which he shall make､ is published throughout all his kingdom, for great it is then all wives will give honour unto their lords, both great and small.

content: 21 And the thing seemed good in the eyes of the king､ and the rulers,—and the king did according to the word of Memucan.
content_old: 21 And the thing seemed good in the eyes of the king､ and the rulers,—and the king did according to the word of Memucan.

content: 1 After these things, when the wrath of King Ahasuerus was appeased he remembered Vashti､ and what she had done, and what was decreed against her.
content_old: 1 After these things, when the wrath of King Ahasuerus was appeased he remembered Vashti､ and what she had done, and what was decreed against her.

content: 2 Then said the young men of the king, who waited upon him,— Let them seek out for the king young virgins､ of pleasing appearance;
content_old: 2 Then said the young men of the king, who waited upon him,— Let them seek out for the king young virgins､ of pleasing appearance;

content: 3 and let the king appoint officers throughout all the provinces of his kingdom, and let them gather together every young virgin of pleasing appearance unto Shusan the palace､ unto the house of the women, into the custody of Hegai eunuch of the king､ keeper of the women, and let there be given the things needed for their purification;
content_old: 3 and let the king appoint officers throughout all the provinces of his kingdom, and let them gather together every young virgin of pleasing appearance unto Shusan the palace､ unto the house of the women, into the custody of Hegai eunuch of the king､ keeper of the women, and let there be given the things needed for their purification;

content: 4 and the maiden that is pleasing in the eyes of the king let her be queen instead of Vashti. And the thing seemed good in the eyes of the king､ and he did so.
content_old: 4 and the maiden that is pleasing in the eyes of the king let her be queen instead of Vashti. And the thing seemed good in the eyes of the king､ and he did so.

content: 5 A certain Jew there was､ in Shusan the palace,—whose name was Mordecai､ son of Jair､ son of Shimei､ son of Kish､ a man of Benjamin;
content_old: 5 A certain Jew there was､ in Shusan the palace,—whose name was Mordecai､ son of Jair､ son of Shimei､ son of Kish､ a man of Benjamin;

content: 6 who had been exiled from Jerusalem, with the exiles who were carried away with Jeconiah king of Judah,—whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon exiled.
content_old: 6 who had been exiled from Jerusalem, with the exiles who were carried away with Jeconiah king of Judah,—whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon exiled.

content: 7 And it came to pass､ that he was bringing up Hadassah､ the same was Esther､ his uncle’s daughter, for she had neither father nor mother,—and the maiden was of beautiful form and pleasing appearance, and when her father and mother died､ Mordecai took her for his own daughter.
content_old: 7 And it came to pass､ that he was bringing up Hadassah､ the same was Esther､ his uncle’s daughter, for she had neither father nor mother,—and the maiden was of beautiful form and pleasing appearance, and when her father and mother died､ Mordecai took her for his own daughter.

content: 8 So it came to pass when the king’s command and decree was heard, and there had been gathered together many maidens unto Shusan the palace､ unto the custody of Hegai that Esther was taken into the house of the king, unto the custody of Hegai､ keeper of the women;
content_old: 8 So it came to pass when the king’s command and decree was heard, and there had been gathered together many maidens unto Shusan the palace､ unto the custody of Hegai that Esther was taken into the house of the king, unto the custody of Hegai､ keeper of the women;

content: 9 and the maiden was pleasing in his eyes､ and she received lovingkindness before him, and he hastened to give her the things needed for her purification､ and things apportioned her, and to give her seven select maidens out of the house of the king,—and he removed her and her maidens to the best place in the house of the women.
content_old: 9 and the maiden was pleasing in his eyes､ and she received lovingkindness before him, and he hastened to give her the things needed for her purification､ and things apportioned her, and to give her seven select maidens out of the house of the king,—and he removed her and her maidens to the best place in the house of the women.

content: 10 Esther had not told of her people､ nor of her kindred,—for Mordecai had laid charge upon her､ that she should not tell.
content_old: 10 Esther had not told of her people､ nor of her kindred,—for Mordecai had laid charge upon her､ that she should not tell.

content: 11 And throughout every day Mordecai used to walk to and fro, before the court of the house of the women,—to get to know the welfare of Esther, and what would be done with her.
content_old: 11 And throughout every day Mordecai used to walk to and fro, before the court of the house of the women,—to get to know the welfare of Esther, and what would be done with her.

content: 12 Now when the turn of each maiden came､ to go in unto King Ahasuerus､ after it had been done to her according to the law of the women for twelve months, for so were fulfilled the days of their purification,—six months with oil of myrrh､ and six months with perfumes､ and with things for the purification of the women
content_old: 12 Now when the turn of each maiden came､ to go in unto King Ahasuerus､ after it had been done to her according to the law of the women for twelve months, for so were fulfilled the days of their purification,—six months with oil of myrrh､ and six months with perfumes､ and with things for the purification of the women

content: 13 then indeed､ the maiden came in unto the king,—whatsoever she might mention was given her､ to go with her, out of the house of the women up to the house of the king:
content_old: 13 then indeed､ the maiden came in unto the king,—whatsoever she might mention was given her､ to go with her, out of the house of the women up to the house of the king:

content: 14 in the evening she､ went in､ and in the morning she､ returned—unto the second house of the women, unto the custody of Shaashgaz the king’s eunuch､ who kept the concubines,—she went not in again unto the king, except the king delighted in her､ and she were called by name.
content_old: 14 in the evening she､ went in､ and in the morning she､ returned—unto the second house of the women, unto the custody of Shaashgaz the king’s eunuch､ who kept the concubines,—she went not in again unto the king, except the king delighted in her､ and she were called by name.

content: 15 But when the turn came for Esther daughter of Abihail the uncle of Mordecai—who had taken her as his own daughter—to go in unto the king she requested nothing, save what Hegai the king’s eunuch who kept the women might direct,—but so it was､ that Esther obtained favour in the eyes of all who beheld her.
content_old: 15 But when the turn came for Esther daughter of Abihail the uncle of Mordecai—who had taken her as his own daughter—to go in unto the king she requested nothing, save what Hegai the king’s eunuch who kept the women might direct,—but so it was､ that Esther obtained favour in the eyes of all who beheld her.

content: 16 So then Esther was taken unto King Ahasuerus､ into his royal house, in the tenth month､ the same was the month Tebeth,—in the seventh year of his reign.
content_old: 16 So then Esther was taken unto King Ahasuerus､ into his royal house, in the tenth month､ the same was the month Tebeth,—in the seventh year of his reign.

content: 17 And the king loved Esther above all the women, and she obtained favour and lovingkindness before him､ above all the virgins,—so that he set the royal crown upon her head, and made her queen､ instead of Vashti.
content_old: 17 And the king loved Esther above all the women, and she obtained favour and lovingkindness before him､ above all the virgins,—so that he set the royal crown upon her head, and made her queen､ instead of Vashti.

content: 18 Then the king made a great banquet､ for all his rulers and his servants, the banquet of Esther,—and a remission for all the provinces made he, and gave a present､ according to the bounty of a king.
content_old: 18 Then the king made a great banquet､ for all his rulers and his servants, the banquet of Esther,—and a remission for all the provinces made he, and gave a present､ according to the bounty of a king.

content: 19 Now when virgins were gathered together a second time then Mordecai was sitting in the gate of the king.
content_old: 19 Now when virgins were gathered together a second time then Mordecai was sitting in the gate of the king.

content: 20 Esther had not told of her kindred､ nor her people, as Mordecai had laid charge upon her,—and the command of Mordecai Esther performed, like as when she was being brought up with him.
content_old: 20 Esther had not told of her kindred､ nor her people, as Mordecai had laid charge upon her,—and the command of Mordecai Esther performed, like as when she was being brought up with him.

content: 21 In those days, when Mordecai was sitting in the gate of the king Bigthan and Teresh､ two of the eunuchs of the king who guarded the threshold, were wroth, and sought to thrust a hand upon King Ahasuerus;
content_old: 21 In those days, when Mordecai was sitting in the gate of the king Bigthan and Teresh､ two of the eunuchs of the king who guarded the threshold, were wroth, and sought to thrust a hand upon King Ahasuerus;

content: 22 but the thing became known to Mordecai, who told it unto Esther the queen,—and Esther told it unto the king､ in the name of Mordecai.
content_old: 22 but the thing became known to Mordecai, who told it unto Esther the queen,—and Esther told it unto the king､ in the name of Mordecai.

content: 1 After these things did King Ahasuerus promote to power Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite､ and exalted him,—and placed his seat above all the rulers who were with him.
content_old: 1 After these things did King Ahasuerus promote to power Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite､ and exalted him,—and placed his seat above all the rulers who were with him.

content: 2 And all the king’s servants who were in the king’s gate used to bend and bow themselves down unto Haman, for so had the king given command concerning him,—but Mordecai bent not nor bowed himself down.
content_old: 2 And all the king’s servants who were in the king’s gate used to bend and bow themselves down unto Haman, for so had the king given command concerning him,—but Mordecai bent not nor bowed himself down.

content: 3 Then said the king’s servants who were in the king’s gate､ unto Mordecai,—
content_old: 3 Then said the king’s servants who were in the king’s gate､ unto Mordecai,—

content: 4 Wherefore art thou transgressing the command of the king? And it came to pass when they had spoken unto him day by day, and he had not hearkened unto them that they told Haman､ to see whether the account of Mordecai would stand, for he had told them､ that he was a Jew.
content_old: 4 Wherefore art thou transgressing the command of the king? And it came to pass when they had spoken unto him day by day, and he had not hearkened unto them that they told Haman､ to see whether the account of Mordecai would stand, for he had told them､ that he was a Jew.

content: 5 And when Haman saw that Mordecai did not bend nor bow down unto him then was Haman filled with wrath;
content_old: 5 And when Haman saw that Mordecai did not bend nor bow down unto him then was Haman filled with wrath;

content: 6 but it was contemptible in his eyes to thrust forth a hand on Mordecai alone, for they had told him of the people of Mordecai,—and Haman sought to destroy all the Jews who were throughout all the kingdom of Ahasuerus､ the people of Mordecai.
content_old: 6 but it was contemptible in his eyes to thrust forth a hand on Mordecai alone, for they had told him of the people of Mordecai,—and Haman sought to destroy all the Jews who were throughout all the kingdom of Ahasuerus､ the people of Mordecai.

content: 7 In the first month—the same was the month Nisan, in the twelfth year of king Ahasuerus was Pur cast—the same is the Lot､ before Haman､ from day to day､ and from month to month,—and the lot fell on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month､ the same is the month Adar.
content_old: 7 In the first month—the same was the month Nisan, in the twelfth year of king Ahasuerus was Pur cast—the same is the Lot､ before Haman､ from day to day､ and from month to month,—and the lot fell on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month､ the same is the month Adar.

content: 8 Then said Haman unto King Ahasuerus, There is a certain people､ scattered abroad and dispersed among the peoples, throughout all the provinces of thy kingdom,—whose laws are diverse from every people､ and the laws of the king they observe not, for the king therefore､ it is not fit､ to suffer them.
content_old: 8 Then said Haman unto King Ahasuerus, There is a certain people､ scattered abroad and dispersed among the peoples, throughout all the provinces of thy kingdom,—whose laws are diverse from every people､ and the laws of the king they observe not, for the king therefore､ it is not fit､ to suffer them.

content: 9 If unto the king it seem good let it be written､ to destroy them,—and ten thousand talents of silver will I weigh out upon the hands of them who are doing the business, to bring it into the treasuries of the king.
content_old: 9 If unto the king it seem good let it be written､ to destroy them,—and ten thousand talents of silver will I weigh out upon the hands of them who are doing the business, to bring it into the treasuries of the king.

content: 10 So then the king took his signet-ring from off his hand, and gave it unto Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite､ the adversary of the Jews;
content_old: 10 So then the king took his signet-ring from off his hand, and gave it unto Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite､ the adversary of the Jews;

content: 11 and the king said unto Haman, The silver is granted thee,—and the people, to do with them､ as may seem good in thine eyes.
content_old: 11 and the king said unto Haman, The silver is granted thee,—and the people, to do with them､ as may seem good in thine eyes.

content: 12 Then were called the scribes of the king､ in the first month､ on the thirteeth day therein, and it was written according to all that Haman commanded unto the satraps of the king､ and unto the pashas､ who were over every province､ and unto the rulers of every people, every province according to the writing thereof, and every people according to the tongue thereof,—in the name of King Ahasuerus was it written, and sealed with the signetring of the king.
content_old: 12 Then were called the scribes of the king､ in the first month､ on the thirteeth day therein, and it was written according to all that Haman commanded unto the satraps of the king､ and unto the pashas､ who were over every province､ and unto the rulers of every people, every province according to the writing thereof, and every people according to the tongue thereof,—in the name of King Ahasuerus was it written, and sealed with the signetring of the king.

content: 13 Then were sent letters､ by the hand of the runners､ into all the provinces of the king, To destroy､ to slay and to cause to perish all Jews､ both young and old､ little ones and women､ in one day, on the thirteenth of the twelfth month the same is the month Adar,—and the spoil of them to be a prey.
content_old: 13 Then were sent letters､ by the hand of the runners､ into all the provinces of the king, To destroy､ to slay and to cause to perish all Jews､ both young and old､ little ones and women､ in one day, on the thirteenth of the twelfth month the same is the month Adar,—and the spoil of them to be a prey.

content: 14 A copy of the writing､ to be delivered as an edict throughout every province was published to all the peoples,—that they should be ready against this day.
content_old: 14 A copy of the writing､ to be delivered as an edict throughout every province was published to all the peoples,—that they should be ready against this day.

content: 1 When Mordecai came to know all that had been done Mordecai rent his garments, and put on sackcloth､ and ashes,—and went forth into the midst of the city, and cried out with an outcry loud and bitter;
content_old: 1 When Mordecai came to know all that had been done Mordecai rent his garments, and put on sackcloth､ and ashes,—and went forth into the midst of the city, and cried out with an outcry loud and bitter;

content: 2 and went in as far as before the gate of the king,—for none might enter into the gate of the king､ clothed with sackcloth.
content_old: 2 and went in as far as before the gate of the king,—for none might enter into the gate of the king､ clothed with sackcloth.

content: 3 And throughout every province､ whithersoever the word of the king and his edict came was great mourning to the Jews, and fasting and weeping､ and lamentation,—sackcloth and ashes were spread out for many.
content_old: 3 And throughout every province､ whithersoever the word of the king and his edict came was great mourning to the Jews, and fasting and weeping､ and lamentation,—sackcloth and ashes were spread out for many.

content: 4 So the maidens of Esther and her eunuchs went in and told her, and the queen writhed in great anguish,—and sent garments to clothe Mordecai､ and to remove his sackcloth from off him､ but he accepted them not.
content_old: 4 So the maidens of Esther and her eunuchs went in and told her, and the queen writhed in great anguish,—and sent garments to clothe Mordecai､ and to remove his sackcloth from off him､ but he accepted them not.

content: 5 Then called Esther for Hathach､ one of the eunuchs of the king whom he had stationed before her, and charged him､ concerning Mordecai,—to get to know what this was､ and why this was.
content_old: 5 Then called Esther for Hathach､ one of the eunuchs of the king whom he had stationed before her, and charged him､ concerning Mordecai,—to get to know what this was､ and why this was.

content: 6 So Hathach went forth unto Mordecai,—in the broadway of the city, which was before the gate of the king.
content_old: 6 So Hathach went forth unto Mordecai,—in the broadway of the city, which was before the gate of the king.

content: 7 And Mordecai told him all that had befallen him,—and an exact statement of the silver､ that Haman had promised to weigh out unto the treasuries of the king､ for the Jews､ to destroy them.
content_old: 7 And Mordecai told him all that had befallen him,—and an exact statement of the silver､ that Haman had promised to weigh out unto the treasuries of the king､ for the Jews､ to destroy them.

content: 8 Also a copy of the writing of the edict which had been given in Shusan to destroy them gave he unto him, to shew unto Esther､ and to tell her,—and to lay charge upon her､ to go in unto the king—to make supplication unto him､ and to make request before him､ for her people.
content_old: 8 Also a copy of the writing of the edict which had been given in Shusan to destroy them gave he unto him, to shew unto Esther､ and to tell her,—and to lay charge upon her､ to go in unto the king—to make supplication unto him､ and to make request before him､ for her people.

content: 9 And Hathach came in and told Esther､ the words of Mordecai.
content_old: 9 And Hathach came in and told Esther､ the words of Mordecai.

content: 10 Then spake Esther unto Hathach,—and gave him charge､ unto Mordecai:—
content_old: 10 Then spake Esther unto Hathach,—and gave him charge､ unto Mordecai:—

content: 11 All the servants of the king､ and the people of the provinces of the king do know､ that whatsoever man or woman shall go in unto the king—into the inter court—who hath not been called one is his law､ to put him to death, saving any to whom the king may hold out the golden sceptre､ who then shall live,—but I have not been called to go in unto the king, these thirty days.
content_old: 11 All the servants of the king､ and the people of the provinces of the king do know､ that whatsoever man or woman shall go in unto the king—into the inter court—who hath not been called one is his law､ to put him to death, saving any to whom the king may hold out the golden sceptre､ who then shall live,—but I have not been called to go in unto the king, these thirty days.

content: 12 And they told Mordecai､ the words of Esther.
content_old: 12 And they told Mordecai､ the words of Esther.

content: 13 Then Mordecai commanded to answer Esther,— Do not think in thine own soul, to escape in the house of the king from among all the Jews.
content_old: 13 Then Mordecai commanded to answer Esther,— Do not think in thine own soul, to escape in the house of the king from among all the Jews.

content: 14 But if thou do indeed hold thy peace at this time respite and deliverance will be appointed for the Jews､ from another place, but thou､ and thy father’s house will perish,—and who knoweth whether for a time such as this thou hast attained unto the royal estate?
content_old: 14 But if thou do indeed hold thy peace at this time respite and deliverance will be appointed for the Jews､ from another place, but thou､ and thy father’s house will perish,—and who knoweth whether for a time such as this thou hast attained unto the royal estate?

content: 15 Then Esther commanded､ to answer Mordecai:—
content_old: 15 Then Esther commanded､ to answer Mordecai:—

content: 16 Go! gather ye together all the Jews who are to be found in Shusan､ and fast ye for me—and neither eat nor drink—three days､ night nor day, and I and my maidens will fast so,—and in this manner will I go in unto the king､ though it is not according to the law, and when I have perished I have perished!
content_old: 16 Go! gather ye together all the Jews who are to be found in Shusan､ and fast ye for me—and neither eat nor drink—three days､ night nor day, and I and my maidens will fast so,—and in this manner will I go in unto the king､ though it is not according to the law, and when I have perished I have perished!

content: 1 And it came to pass､ on the third day､ that Esther put on her royal apparel, and stood in the inner court of the house of the king､ over against the house of the king,—and the king was sitting upon his royal seat､ in the royal house, over against the opening of the house.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ on the third day､ that Esther put on her royal apparel, and stood in the inner court of the house of the king､ over against the house of the king,—and the king was sitting upon his royal seat､ in the royal house, over against the opening of the house.

content: 2 And it came to pass when the king saw Esther the queen standing in the court that she obtained favour in his eyes,—and the king held out to Esther､ the golden sceptre which was in his hand, so Esther drew near､ and touched the top of the sceptre.
content_old: 2 And it came to pass when the king saw Esther the queen standing in the court that she obtained favour in his eyes,—and the king held out to Esther､ the golden sceptre which was in his hand, so Esther drew near､ and touched the top of the sceptre.

content: 3 Then said the king unto her､ What aileth thee､ Queen Esther? and what is thy request? Unto the half of the kingdom shall it be given thee.
content_old: 3 Then said the king unto her､ What aileth thee､ Queen Esther? and what is thy request? Unto the half of the kingdom shall it be given thee.

content: 4 Then said Esther, If unto the king it seem good let the king with Haman come in this day, unto the banquet which I have prepared for him.
content_old: 4 Then said Esther, If unto the king it seem good let the king with Haman come in this day, unto the banquet which I have prepared for him.

content: 5 And the king said, Hasten ye Haman, to perform the word of Esther. So the king with Haman came in, unto the banquet which Esther had prepared.
content_old: 5 And the king said, Hasten ye Haman, to perform the word of Esther. So the king with Haman came in, unto the banquet which Esther had prepared.

content: 6 Then said the king unto Esther､ during the banquet of wine, What is thy petition､ that it may be granted thee?—and what is thy request—unto the half of the kingdom—that it may be performed?
content_old: 6 Then said the king unto Esther､ during the banquet of wine, What is thy petition､ that it may be granted thee?—and what is thy request—unto the half of the kingdom—that it may be performed?

content: 7 Then answered Esther､ and said,— As touching my petition and my request
content_old: 7 Then answered Esther､ and said,— As touching my petition and my request

content: 8 If I have found favour in the eyes of the king､ and if unto the king it seem good, to grant my petition､ and to perform my request let the king with Haman come in unto the banquet which I will prepare for them, and to-morrow I will do､ according to the word of the king.
content_old: 8 If I have found favour in the eyes of the king､ and if unto the king it seem good, to grant my petition､ and to perform my request let the king with Haman come in unto the banquet which I will prepare for them, and to-morrow I will do､ according to the word of the king.

content: 9 Then went Haman forth on that day, joyful and of a merry heart,—but when Haman saw Mordecai in the gate of the king､ that he rose not up nor moved because of him then was Haman filled with wrath against Mordecai.
content_old: 9 Then went Haman forth on that day, joyful and of a merry heart,—but when Haman saw Mordecai in the gate of the king､ that he rose not up nor moved because of him then was Haman filled with wrath against Mordecai.

content: 10 Nevertheless Haman restrained himself, and came into his own house,—and sent and brought in his friends､ and Zeresh his wife;
content_old: 10 Nevertheless Haman restrained himself, and came into his own house,—and sent and brought in his friends､ and Zeresh his wife;

content: 11 and Haman recounted unto them the glory of his riches�� and the multitude of his children,—and all the things wherein the king had promoted him to power､ and how he had advanced him, above the rulers and the servants of the king.
content_old: 11 and Haman recounted unto them the glory of his riches�� and the multitude of his children,—and all the things wherein the king had promoted him to power､ and how he had advanced him, above the rulers and the servants of the king.

content: 12 And Haman said, Moreover Esther the queen did bring in no one with the king into the banquet which she had prepared､ saving myself,—yea moreover even for to-morrow I am invited unto her､ with the king.
content_old: 12 And Haman said, Moreover Esther the queen did bring in no one with the king into the banquet which she had prepared､ saving myself,—yea moreover even for to-morrow I am invited unto her､ with the king.

content: 13 Yet all this sufficeth me not,—so long as I see Mordecai the Jew, sitting in the gate of the king.
content_old: 13 Yet all this sufficeth me not,—so long as I see Mordecai the Jew, sitting in the gate of the king.

content: 1 During that night the sleep of the king fled,—and he commanded to bring in the book of remembrance､ the chronicles､ and they were read before the king.
content_old: 1 During that night the sleep of the king fled,—and he commanded to bring in the book of remembrance､ the chronicles､ and they were read before the king.

content: 2 And it was found written､ how that Mordecai had told concerning Bigthana and Teresh､ the two eunuchs of the king guarding the threshold,—who had sought to thrust forth a hand upon King Ahasuerus.
content_old: 2 And it was found written､ how that Mordecai had told concerning Bigthana and Teresh､ the two eunuchs of the king guarding the threshold,—who had sought to thrust forth a hand upon King Ahasuerus.

content: 3 Then said the king, What honour and dignity hath been done unto Mordecai､ for this? Then said the king’s young men､ who were ministering unto him, Nothing hath been done for him.
content_old: 3 Then said the king, What honour and dignity hath been done unto Mordecai､ for this? Then said the king’s young men､ who were ministering unto him, Nothing hath been done for him.

content: 4 Then said the king､ Who is in the court? Now Haman had come into the outer court of the king’s house, to speak unto the king､ to hang Mordecai､ upon the gallows which he had prepared for him.
content_old: 4 Then said the king､ Who is in the court? Now Haman had come into the outer court of the king’s house, to speak unto the king､ to hang Mordecai､ upon the gallows which he had prepared for him.

content: 5 So the king’s young men said unto him, Lo! Haman standing in the court. And the king said､ Let him come in.
content_old: 5 So the king’s young men said unto him, Lo! Haman standing in the court. And the king said､ Let him come in.

content: 6 So Haman came in, and the king said unto him, What shall be done unto the man in whose honour the king delighteth? Then said Haman､ in his own heart, Unto whom will the king delight to do honour､ more than unto me?
content_old: 6 So Haman came in, and the king said unto him, What shall be done unto the man in whose honour the king delighteth? Then said Haman､ in his own heart, Unto whom will the king delight to do honour､ more than unto me?

content: 7 So Haman said unto the king,— As touching the man in whose honour the king delighteth
content_old: 7 So Haman said unto the king,— As touching the man in whose honour the king delighteth

content: 8 let them bring in royal apparel wherewith the king hath clothed himself,—and the horse whereon the king hath ridden, and the royal crown which hath been set upon his own head;
content_old: 8 let them bring in royal apparel wherewith the king hath clothed himself,—and the horse whereon the king hath ridden, and the royal crown which hath been set upon his own head;

content: 9 and let the apparel and the horse be delivered unto the hand of one of the king’s rulers､ one of the nobles, and so let them array the man､ in whose honour the king delighteth,—and cause him to ride upon the horse through the broadway of the city, and let them proclaim before him, Thus and thus shall it be done unto the man in whose honour the king delighteth!
content_old: 9 and let the apparel and the horse be delivered unto the hand of one of the king’s rulers､ one of the nobles, and so let them array the man､ in whose honour the king delighteth,—and cause him to ride upon the horse through the broadway of the city, and let them proclaim before him, Thus and thus shall it be done unto the man in whose honour the king delighteth!

content: 10 Then said the king unto Haman､ Haste､ take the apparel and the horse､ just as thou hast said, and do even so unto Mordecai the Jew, who is sitting in the king’s gate,—do not let fail a thing, of all which thou hast spoken!
content_old: 10 Then said the king unto Haman､ Haste､ take the apparel and the horse､ just as thou hast said, and do even so unto Mordecai the Jew, who is sitting in the king’s gate,—do not let fail a thing, of all which thou hast spoken!

content: 11 So Haman took the apparel and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai,—and caused him to ride through the broadway of the city, and proclaimed before him､ Thus and thus shall it be done unto the man in whose honour the king delighteth!
content_old: 11 So Haman took the apparel and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai,—and caused him to ride through the broadway of the city, and proclaimed before him､ Thus and thus shall it be done unto the man in whose honour the king delighteth!

content: 12 Then Mordecai returned unto the gate of the king,—but Haman hurried unto his own house, mourning､ and with covered head.
content_old: 12 Then Mordecai returned unto the gate of the king,—but Haman hurried unto his own house, mourning､ and with covered head.

content: 13 And Haman recounted unto Zeresh his wife､ and unto all his friends, everything that had befallen him. Then said his wise men､ and Zeresh his wife､ unto him, If of the seed of the Jews is Mordecai before whom thou hast begun to fall thou shalt not prevail against him, but shalt utterly fall before him.
content_old: 13 And Haman recounted unto Zeresh his wife､ and unto all his friends, everything that had befallen him. Then said his wise men､ and Zeresh his wife､ unto him, If of the seed of the Jews is Mordecai before whom thou hast begun to fall thou shalt not prevail against him, but shalt utterly fall before him.

content: 1 So the king and Haman came in, to banquet with Esther the queen.
content_old: 1 So the king and Haman came in, to banquet with Esther the queen.

content: 2 Then said the king unto Esther､ on the second day also､ during the banquet of wine, What is thy petition､ Queen Esther､ that it may be granted thee? and what is thy request—unto the half of the kingdom—that it may be performed?
content_old: 2 Then said the king unto Esther､ on the second day also､ during the banquet of wine, What is thy petition､ Queen Esther､ that it may be granted thee? and what is thy request—unto the half of the kingdom—that it may be performed?

content: 3 Then answered Esther the queen､ and said､ If I have found favour in thine eyes､ O king, and if unto the king it seem good let my life be granted me､ as my petition, and my people､ as my request;
content_old: 3 Then answered Esther the queen､ and said､ If I have found favour in thine eyes､ O king, and if unto the king it seem good let my life be granted me､ as my petition, and my people､ as my request;

content: 4 For we are sold､ I and my people, to be destroyed､ to be slain and to be caused to perish. If indeed for bondmen and for bondwomen we had been sold I had held my peace, although the adversary could not have made good the damage to the king.
content_old: 4 For we are sold､ I and my people, to be destroyed､ to be slain and to be caused to perish. If indeed for bondmen and for bondwomen we had been sold I had held my peace, although the adversary could not have made good the damage to the king.

content: 5 Then spake King Ahasuerus, and said unto Esther the queen,— Who is he now､ and where is he, whose heart is set to act thus?
content_old: 5 Then spake King Ahasuerus, and said unto Esther the queen,— Who is he now､ and where is he, whose heart is set to act thus?

content: 6 And Esther said, A man who is an adversary and enemy, this wicked Haman. And Haman was terrified, before the king and the queen.
content_old: 6 And Esther said, A man who is an adversary and enemy, this wicked Haman. And Haman was terrified, before the king and the queen.

content: 7 Now the king arising in his wrath from the banquet of wine, and going into the palace garden Haman stood to make request for his life from Esther the queen, for he saw that ruin was determined against him by the king.
content_old: 7 Now the king arising in his wrath from the banquet of wine, and going into the palace garden Haman stood to make request for his life from Esther the queen, for he saw that ruin was determined against him by the king.

content: 8 When the king returned out of the palace garden into the place of the banquet of wine Haman was lying prostrate upon the couch whereon Esther was. Then said the king, Will he even dare to force the queen while I am in the house? No sooner had the word gone forth out of the mouth of the king than the face of Haman they had covered.
content_old: 8 When the king returned out of the palace garden into the place of the banquet of wine Haman was lying prostrate upon the couch whereon Esther was. Then said the king, Will he even dare to force the queen while I am in the house? No sooner had the word gone forth out of the mouth of the king than the face of Haman they had covered.

content: 9 Then said Harbonah—one of the eunuchs before the king､— Yea lo! the gallows that Haman made ready for Mordecai､ who had spoken well for the king is standing in Haman’s house, of a height of fifty cubits. Then said the king､ Hang him thereon.
content_old: 9 Then said Harbonah—one of the eunuchs before the king､— Yea lo! the gallows that Haman made ready for Mordecai､ who had spoken well for the king is standing in Haman’s house, of a height of fifty cubits. Then said the king､ Hang him thereon.

content: 1 On that day did King Ahasuerus give unto Esther the queen, the house of Haman､ the adversary of the Jews,—and Mordecai came in before the king, for Esther had told､ what he was to her.
content_old: 1 On that day did King Ahasuerus give unto Esther the queen, the house of Haman､ the adversary of the Jews,—and Mordecai came in before the king, for Esther had told､ what he was to her.

content: 2 And the king took off his signet-ring､ which he had taken from Haman, and gave it unto Mordecai,—and Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.
content_old: 2 And the king took off his signet-ring､ which he had taken from Haman, and gave it unto Mordecai,—and Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman.

content: 3 Yet again spake Esther before the king, and fell down at his feet,—and wept and made supplication unto him､ to cause the mischief of Haman the Agagite to pass away, even the plot which he had plotted against the Jews.
content_old: 3 Yet again spake Esther before the king, and fell down at his feet,—and wept and made supplication unto him､ to cause the mischief of Haman the Agagite to pass away, even the plot which he had plotted against the Jews.

content: 4 And the king held out unto Esther, the golden sceptre,—so Esther arose, and stood before the king;
content_old: 4 And the king held out unto Esther, the golden sceptre,—so Esther arose, and stood before the king;

content: 5 and said— If unto the king it seem good､ and if I have found favour before him､ and the thing be approved before the king, and I myself be pleasing in his eyes let it be written､ to reverse the letters plotted by Haman､ son of Hammedatha､ the Agagite, which he wrote to destroy the Jews, who are in all the provinces of the king.
content_old: 5 and said— If unto the king it seem good､ and if I have found favour before him､ and the thing be approved before the king, and I myself be pleasing in his eyes let it be written､ to reverse the letters plotted by Haman､ son of Hammedatha､ the Agagite, which he wrote to destroy the Jews, who are in all the provinces of the king.

content: 6 For how can I endure to see the ruin that shall overtake my people? or how can I endure to see the destruction of my kindred?
content_old: 6 For how can I endure to see the ruin that shall overtake my people? or how can I endure to see the destruction of my kindred?

content: 7 Then said King Ahasuerus unto Esther the queen, and unto Mordecai the Jew,— Lo! the house of Haman have I given unto Esther､ and him have they hanged upon the gallows, because he thrust forth his hand against the Jews.
content_old: 7 Then said King Ahasuerus unto Esther the queen, and unto Mordecai the Jew,— Lo! the house of Haman have I given unto Esther､ and him have they hanged upon the gallows, because he thrust forth his hand against the Jews.

content: 8 Ye therefore､ write concerning the Jews as may seem good in your own eyes､ in the name of the king, and seal it with the king’s signet-ring,—for a writing which hath been written in the king’s name､ and sealed with the king’s signet-ring none can reverse.
content_old: 8 Ye therefore､ write concerning the Jews as may seem good in your own eyes､ in the name of the king, and seal it with the king’s signet-ring,—for a writing which hath been written in the king’s name､ and sealed with the king’s signet-ring none can reverse.

content: 9 Then were called the king’s scribes at that time—in the third month､ the same is the month Siwân､ on the twenty-third thereof, and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded unto the Jews､ and unto the satraps and pashas and rulers of the provinces､ which are from India even unto Ethiopia､ a hundred and twenty-seven provinces, every province according to the writing thereof, and every people according to their tongue,—and unto the Jews, according to their writing､ and according to their tongue;
content_old: 9 Then were called the king’s scribes at that time—in the third month､ the same is the month Siwân､ on the twenty-third thereof, and it was written according to all that Mordecai commanded unto the Jews､ and unto the satraps and pashas and rulers of the provinces､ which are from India even unto Ethiopia､ a hundred and twenty-seven provinces, every province according to the writing thereof, and every people according to their tongue,—and unto the Jews, according to their writing､ and according to their tongue;

content: 10 and he wrote in the name of King Ahasuerus, and sealed it with the king’s signet-ring,—and sent letters by the hand of runners on horses､ riding the swift steeds used in the king’s service, bred of the stud:
content_old: 10 and he wrote in the name of King Ahasuerus, and sealed it with the king’s signet-ring,—and sent letters by the hand of runners on horses､ riding the swift steeds used in the king’s service, bred of the stud:

content: 11 That the king had granted unto the Jews who were in every city､ to gather themselves together､ and to stand for their life, to destroy､ to slay and to cause to perish—all the force of the people and province who should distress them､ their little ones and women,—and to take the spoil of them as a prey:—
content_old: 11 That the king had granted unto the Jews who were in every city､ to gather themselves together､ and to stand for their life, to destroy､ to slay and to cause to perish—all the force of the people and province who should distress them､ their little ones and women,—and to take the spoil of them as a prey:—

content: 12 upon one day throughout all the provinces of King Ahasuerus,—upon the thirteenth of the twelfth month､ the same is the month Adar:
content_old: 12 upon one day throughout all the provinces of King Ahasuerus,—upon the thirteenth of the twelfth month､ the same is the month Adar:

content: 13 A copy of the writing to be given､ as an edict､ throughout every province, was published to all the peoples,—and that the Jews be ready against that day, to avenge themselves on their enemies.
content_old: 13 A copy of the writing to be given､ as an edict､ throughout every province, was published to all the peoples,—and that the Jews be ready against that day, to avenge themselves on their enemies.

content: 14 The runners that rode on the swift steeds used in the king’s service went forth､ being urged forward and pressed on､ by the word of the king,—and the edict was given in Shusan the palace.
content_old: 14 The runners that rode on the swift steeds used in the king’s service went forth､ being urged forward and pressed on､ by the word of the king,—and the edict was given in Shusan the palace.

content: 15 And Mordecai went forth from the presence of the king､ in royal apparel､ of blue and white, with a large diadem of gold､ and a mantle of fine linen and purple,—and the city Shusan was bright and joyful.
content_old: 15 And Mordecai went forth from the presence of the king､ in royal apparel､ of blue and white, with a large diadem of gold､ and a mantle of fine linen and purple,—and the city Shusan was bright and joyful.

content: 16 To the Jews had come light､ and joy,—and gladness and honour.
content_old: 16 To the Jews had come light､ and joy,—and gladness and honour.

content: 1 And in the twelfth month､ the same is the month Adar､ on the thirteenth day thereof, when the word of the king and his edict arrived to be put in execution,—on the day when the enemies of the Jews hoped to have power over them, though it was changed so that the Jews themselves should have power over them who hated them
content_old: 1 And in the twelfth month､ the same is the month Adar､ on the thirteenth day thereof, when the word of the king and his edict arrived to be put in execution,—on the day when the enemies of the Jews hoped to have power over them, though it was changed so that the Jews themselves should have power over them who hated them

content: 2 the Jews assembled themselves together in their cities､ throughout all the provinces of King Ahasuerus, to thrust forth a hand against them who were seeking their hurt, and no man stood before them, for the dread of them had fallen upon all the peoples.
content_old: 2 the Jews assembled themselves together in their cities､ throughout all the provinces of King Ahasuerus, to thrust forth a hand against them who were seeking their hurt, and no man stood before them, for the dread of them had fallen upon all the peoples.

content: 3 And all the rulers of the provinces､ and the satraps and the pashas､ and the doers of business that pertained to the king were extolling the Jews,—for the dread of Mordecai､ had fallen upon them;
content_old: 3 And all the rulers of the provinces､ and the satraps and the pashas､ and the doers of business that pertained to the king were extolling the Jews,—for the dread of Mordecai､ had fallen upon them;

content: 4 since great was Mordecai､ in the house of the king, and his fame was going forth throughout all the provinces,—for the man Mordecai went on waxing great.
content_old: 4 since great was Mordecai､ in the house of the king, and his fame was going forth throughout all the provinces,—for the man Mordecai went on waxing great.

content: 5 So then the Jews smote all their enemies, with the smiting of the sword and slaughter､ and destruction,—and they dealt with them who hated them according to their pleasure.
content_old: 5 So then the Jews smote all their enemies, with the smiting of the sword and slaughter､ and destruction,—and they dealt with them who hated them according to their pleasure.

content: 6 Yea in Shusan the palace did the Jews slay and destroy five hundred men.
content_old: 6 Yea in Shusan the palace did the Jews slay and destroy five hundred men.

content: 7 And Parshandatha and Dalphôn､ and Aspatha;
content_old: 7 And Parshandatha and Dalphôn､ and Aspatha;

content: 8 and Poratha､ and Adalia, and Aridatha;
content_old: 8 and Poratha､ and Adalia, and Aridatha;

content: 9 and Parmashta､ and Arisai, and Aridai､ and Vaizatha;—
content_old: 9 and Parmashta､ and Arisai, and Aridai､ and Vaizatha;—

content: 10 the ten sons of Haman son of Hammedatha､ the adversary of the Jews slew they,—but on the spoil thrust they not forth their hand.
content_old: 10 the ten sons of Haman son of Hammedatha､ the adversary of the Jews slew they,—but on the spoil thrust they not forth their hand.

content: 11 On that day came in the number of the slain into Shusan the palace､ before the king.
content_old: 11 On that day came in the number of the slain into Shusan the palace､ before the king.

content: 12 Then said the king unto Esther the queen､ In Shusan the palace have the Jews slain and caused to perish five hundred men､ and the ten sons of Haman,—in the rest of the provinces of the king what have they done? What､ then､ is thy petition､ that it may be granted thee? and what is thy request further､ that it may be performed?
content_old: 12 Then said the king unto Esther the queen､ In Shusan the palace have the Jews slain and caused to perish five hundred men､ and the ten sons of Haman,—in the rest of the provinces of the king what have they done? What､ then､ is thy petition､ that it may be granted thee? and what is thy request further､ that it may be performed?

content: 13 Then said Esther､ If unto the king it seem good let it be granted､ to-morrow also､ unto the Jews who are in Shusan, to do according to the edict of to-day,—and that the ten sons of Haman be hanged upon the gallows.
content_old: 13 Then said Esther､ If unto the king it seem good let it be granted､ to-morrow also､ unto the Jews who are in Shusan, to do according to the edict of to-day,—and that the ten sons of Haman be hanged upon the gallows.

content: 14 And the king commanded it to be done so, and there was given an edict､ in Shusan,—and the ten sons of Haman they hanged.
content_old: 14 And the king commanded it to be done so, and there was given an edict､ in Shusan,—and the ten sons of Haman they hanged.

content: 15 So the Jews who were in Shusan assembled themselves together､ on the fourteenth day also､ of the month Adar, and slew in Shusan three hundred men,—but on the spoil thrust they not forth their hand.
content_old: 15 So the Jews who were in Shusan assembled themselves together､ on the fourteenth day also､ of the month Adar, and slew in Shusan three hundred men,—but on the spoil thrust they not forth their hand.

content: 16 And the remainder of the Jews who were in the provinces of the king assembled themselves together and stood for their life､ and then had rest from their enemies, having slain of them that hated them seventy-five thousand,—but on the spoil thrust they not forth their hand:
content_old: 16 And the remainder of the Jews who were in the provinces of the king assembled themselves together and stood for their life､ and then had rest from their enemies, having slain of them that hated them seventy-five thousand,—but on the spoil thrust they not forth their hand:

content: 17 on the thirteenth day of the month Adar,—and then had rest on the fourteenth day thereof, and made it a day of banqueting and rejoicing.
content_old: 17 on the thirteenth day of the month Adar,—and then had rest on the fourteenth day thereof, and made it a day of banqueting and rejoicing.

content: 18 But the Jews who were in Shusan assembled themselves together on the thirteenth day thereof, and on the fourteenth day thereof,—and then had rest on the fifteenth day thereof, and made it a day of banqueting and rejoicing.
content_old: 18 But the Jews who were in Shusan assembled themselves together on the thirteenth day thereof, and on the fourteenth day thereof,—and then had rest on the fifteenth day thereof, and made it a day of banqueting and rejoicing.

content: 19 For this cause the country Jews､ who dwelt in the country towns were making the fourteenth day of the month Adar one of rejoicing and banqueting､ and a day of happiness,—and of sending portions every one to his neighbour.
content_old: 19 For this cause the country Jews､ who dwelt in the country towns were making the fourteenth day of the month Adar one of rejoicing and banqueting､ and a day of happiness,—and of sending portions every one to his neighbour.

content: 20 And Mordecai wrote these things,—and sent letters unto all the Jews who were in all the provinces of King Ahasuerus, near, and far off;
content_old: 20 And Mordecai wrote these things,—and sent letters unto all the Jews who were in all the provinces of King Ahasuerus, near, and far off;

content: 21 to establish for them, that they should continue to observe the fourteenth day of the month Adar, and the fifteenth day thereof,—always year by year;
content_old: 21 to establish for them, that they should continue to observe the fourteenth day of the month Adar, and the fifteenth day thereof,—always year by year;

content: 22 according to the days wherein the Jews found rest from their enemies, and the month which was turned for them､ from sorrow to joy, and from mourning to a happy day,—that they should make them days of banqueting and rejoicing, and of sending portions､ every one to his neighbour, and gifts､ unto the needy.
content_old: 22 according to the days wherein the Jews found rest from their enemies, and the month which was turned for them､ from sorrow to joy, and from mourning to a happy day,—that they should make them days of banqueting and rejoicing, and of sending portions､ every one to his neighbour, and gifts､ unto the needy.

content: 23 And the Jews took upon them that which they had begun to do,—and that which Mordecai had written unto them;
content_old: 23 And the Jews took upon them that which they had begun to do,—and that which Mordecai had written unto them;

content: 24 because Haman､ son of Hammedatha､ the Agagite､ the adversary of all the Jews had plotted against the Jews､ to cause them to perish,—and had cast Pur､ the same is the Lot, to terrify them､ and to destroy them;
content_old: 24 because Haman､ son of Hammedatha､ the Agagite､ the adversary of all the Jews had plotted against the Jews､ to cause them to perish,—and had cast Pur､ the same is the Lot, to terrify them､ and to destroy them;

content: 25 but by Esther’s going in before the king he commanded by letter, that his wicked plot which he had plotted against the Jews､ should return upon his own head,—and that he and his sons should be hanged upon the gallows.
content_old: 25 but by Esther’s going in before the king he commanded by letter, that his wicked plot which he had plotted against the Jews､ should return upon his own head,—and that he and his sons should be hanged upon the gallows.

content: 26 For this cause called they these days Purim､ after the name Pur, for this cause—for all the words of this epistle,—and what they had seen concerning such a matter, and what had reached unto them.
content_old: 26 For this cause called they these days Purim､ after the name Pur, for this cause—for all the words of this epistle,—and what they had seen concerning such a matter, and what had reached unto them.

content: 27 The Jews established and took upon themselves—and upon their seed､ and upon all who should join themselves unto them､ that it might not pass away, that they would continue to keep these two days､ according to the writing concerning them and at their set time,—always year by year.
content_old: 27 The Jews established and took upon themselves—and upon their seed､ and upon all who should join themselves unto them､ that it might not pass away, that they would continue to keep these two days､ according to the writing concerning them and at their set time,—always year by year.

content: 28 And these days were to be remembered and to be kept､ always from generation to generation､ by every family, every province､ and every city,—that these days of Purim should not pass away､ out of the midst of the Jews, and the memorial of them not cease from their seed.
content_old: 28 And these days were to be remembered and to be kept､ always from generation to generation､ by every family, every province､ and every city,—that these days of Purim should not pass away､ out of the midst of the Jews, and the memorial of them not cease from their seed.

content: 29 Then wrote Esther the queen daughter of Abihail and Mordecai the Jew､ with all authority,—to confirm this second epistle concerning the Purim;
content_old: 29 Then wrote Esther the queen daughter of Abihail and Mordecai the Jew､ with all authority,—to confirm this second epistle concerning the Purim;

content: 30 and he sent letters unto all the Jews､ throughout the hundred and twenty-seven provinces of the kingdom of Ahasuerus,—words of peace and stability:
content_old: 30 and he sent letters unto all the Jews､ throughout the hundred and twenty-seven provinces of the kingdom of Ahasuerus,—words of peace and stability:

content: 31 to establish these days of the Purim､ in their set times､ according as Mordecai the Jew and Esther the queen had enjoined upon them, and according as they had enjoined upon their own soul､ and upon their seed,—the story of the fastings and of their outcry.
content_old: 31 to establish these days of the Purim､ in their set times､ according as Mordecai the Jew and Esther the queen had enjoined upon them, and according as they had enjoined upon their own soul､ and upon their seed,—the story of the fastings and of their outcry.

content: 1 And King Ahasuerus laid tribute upon the land､ and upon the shores of the sea.
content_old: 1 And King Ahasuerus laid tribute upon the land､ and upon the shores of the sea.

content: 2 But all the acts of his authority､ and his might, and the clear story of the promotion of Mordecai､ wherewith the king promoted him are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia?
content_old: 2 But all the acts of his authority､ and his might, and the clear story of the promotion of Mordecai､ wherewith the king promoted him are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia?
